dta.TransitSegment¶

class dta.TransitSegment(id, link, label, lane, dwell, stopside)¶

Bases: object

A piece of a TransitLine, basically a link with a transit line on it.

__init__(id, link, label, lane, dwell, stopside)¶

A link in a TransitLine. The arguments are:

  • id segment identifier
  • start starting node ID
  • end ending node ID
  • label user-defined label for the segment or stop, a string
  • tlane is the lane used by the transit line. Use TransitSegment.TRANSIT_LANE_UNSPECIFIED, 1 for the outside lane, 2 for the next in, etc
  • dwell is the average dwell time in seconds, a float
  • stopside is one of TransitSegment.STOP_EXIT_LANE, TransitSegment.STOP_OUTSIDE, or TransitSegment.STOP_INSIDE

Methods

__init__(id, link, label, lane, dwell, stopside) A link in a TransitLine. The arguments are:
getDynameqHeaderStr() Returns the Dynameq-formatted header string (the start of the file preceding the actual transit line data
getDynameqStr() Returns the Dynameq-formatted string representation of the transit segments.

STOP_INSIDE¶

What do these mean?

STOP_OUTSIDE¶

What do these mean?

TRANSIT_LANE_UNSPECIFIED¶

If the transit lane is unspecified use this for the lane arg to TransitSegment.__init__()

classmethod getDynameqHeaderStr()¶

Returns the Dynameq-formatted header string (the start of the file preceding the actual transit line data

getDynameqStr()¶

Returns the Dynameq-formatted string representation of the transit segments.
